proxy.title: Proxy gravatars
proxy.helptext: By default, gravatar URLs are fetched directly from gravatar.com. This enables all gravatar requests to be served directly by the forum itself.

replace-flarum-custom.title: Replace custom avatars uploaded to Forum
replace-flarum-custom.helptext: Replace custom avatars already uploaded to the forum with a Gravatar

defaults.title: Defaults
defaults.helptext: What happens when an email address has no matching Gravatar image? Gravatar has a number of built in options which you can use as defaults. Most of these work by taking the requested email hash and using it to generate a themed image that is unique to that email address.
defaults.mp_label: mp: (mystery-person) a simple, cartoon-style silhouetted outline of a person (does not vary by email hash)
defaults.identicon_label: identicon: a geometric pattern based on an email hash
defaults.monsterid_label: monsterid: a generated 'monster' with different colors, faces, etc
defaults.wavatar_label: wavatar: generated faces with differing features and backgrounds
defaults.retro_label: retro: awesome generated, 8-bit arcade-style pixelated faces
defaults.robohash_label: robohash: a generated robot with different colors, faces, etc

rating.title: Rating
rating.helptext: Gravatar allows users to self-rate their images so that they can indicate if an image is appropriate for a certain audience. By default, only 'G' rated images are displayed unless you indicate that you would like to see higher ratings. You may specify one of the following ratings to request images up to and including that rating.
rating.g_label: g: suitable for display on all websites with any audience type
rating.pg_label: pg: may contain rude gestures, provocatively dressed individuals, the lesser swear words, or mild violence
rating.r_label: r: may contain such things as harsh profanity, intense violence, nudity, or hard drug use
rating.x_label: x: may contain hardcore sexual imagery or extremely disturbing violence

force-default.title: Force default
force-default.helptext: Forces the use of a default set, even if the email hash links to a custom user uploaded avatar
